name: DUKE ENERGY FAYETTE II, LLC v. FAYETTE COUNTY BOARD OF ASSESSMENT APPEALS v. Fayette County, German Township and Albert Gallatin Area School District. Petition of Albert Gallatin Area School District
name_abbreviation: Duke Energy Fayette II, LLC v. Fayette County Board of Assessment Appeals

judges: Justice EAKIN did not participate in the decision of this matter.
parties: DUKE ENERGY FAYETTE II, LLC v. FAYETTE COUNTY BOARD OF ASSESSMENT APPEALS v. Fayette County, German Township and Albert Gallatin Area School District. Petition of Albert Gallatin Area School District.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 30th day of December, 2015, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED. The issue, as stated by petitioner, is:
(1) Whether Fayette County’s reassessment of improved power plant real estate located within a Keystone Opportunity Zone and exempt from real estate taxation constituted a spot reassessment where the reassessment occurred in the year immediately following expiration of the Keystone Opportunity Zone tax exemption?
Justice EAKIN did not participate in the decision of this matter.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
129 A.3d 1237
DUKE ENERGY FAYETTE II, LLC v. FAYETTE COUNTY BOARD OF ASSESSMENT APPEALS v. Fayette County, German Township and Albert Gallatin Area School District. Petition of Albert Gallatin Area School District.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Dec. 30, 2015.
